column1: Just an update of Benny's OP.This morning, Sunday 22/03/2020, the Spanish Prime Minister, Pedro Sánchez, confirmed that the state of alert in Spain will be extended for an additional 15 days once the exsiting one expires.It just requires the formal authorisation by the Spanish Congress as required by the constitution and objections are not expected from any quarter.In english courtesy of Murcia Today: https://murciatoday.com/state_of_emergency_i…If your native language isn't english, you can translate from spanish here courtesy of La Opinión de Murcia: https:/…1101270.html
world news reports say Spain is 3 weeks behind the eightball in Europe that's why much more cases are appearing each day in Spain in alarming amounts with the virus.

Just an update on the news from this morning...The Spanish government will seek to extend the current confinement (ending 11/04/2020) for an additional 2 weeks until 26/04/2020.Subject of course to the usual approval of congress as required by Spain's constitution.In english: https://english.elpais.com/politics/2020-04-…In spanish: https://elpais.com/espana/2020-04-04/sanchez…Cierra la puerta al Coronavirus! #QuédateEnCasa

Just to update this...The extension of the state of alert in Spain received approval from Congress yesterday extending quarantine measures until at least 26/04/2020 once the current confinment period ends in 2 days time.The PM Pedro Sánchez has already stated that in his opinion, he'll have to request a further extension before the new extension to 26/04/2020 ends.In english: https://english.elpais.com/politics/2020-04-…In spanish: https://elpais.com/espana/2020-04-09/sanchez…Cierra la puerta al Coronavirus! #QuédateEnCasa
Spains political system is fairly fractured,it may well be more difficult to sell to congress the idea of another extension after the 26th.Atb steve

Hi Steve,Yup, fractured is right. The PP & VOX are both already kicking off about any possible extension after 26/04.Monday sees the start of a staggered return to work for manufacturing and construction workers.That's going to be interesting...Keep safe!Cierra la puerta al Coronavirus! #QuédateEnCasa

*Update*In a televised address this evening, the Spanish PM, Pedro Sánchez, confirmed that he will apply for another 15 day extension of confinement measures once the current state of alert expires. The new extension, if approved by Congress, will take restrictions up to 09/05/2020.In english: https://english.elpais.com/society/2020-04-1…In spanish: https://elpais.com/espana/2020-04-18/el-gobi…Cierra la puerta al Coronavirus! #QuédateEnCasa

*Update*Yesterday, Spain's Congress voted to extend the state of alert until 09/05/2020.De-escaltion of the lockdown will be 'slow & gradual' and re-imposition of restrictions may be necessary if and when the virus re-emerges according to the PM.In english: https://english.elpais.com/politics/2020-04-…In spanish: https://elpais.com/espana/politica/2020-04-2…

*Update*Yesterday, Spain's Congress voted to extend the state of alert until 24/05/2020.In english: https://english.elpais.com/politics/2020-05-…In spanish: https://elpais.com/espana/politica/2020-05-0…Most of the country (other than El Hierro, La Gomera, La Graciosa & Formentera already in de-escalation phase 1) is in de-escaltion phase 0.
